verses.kjv: And he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.
verses.web: He went out from there. He came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.
verses.ct: Jesus left that area and went to his hometown, and his disciples went with him.

verses.kjv: And when the sabbath day was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearing him were astonished, saying, From whence hath this man these things? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him, that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands?
verses.web: When the Sabbath had come, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many hearing him were astonished, saying, “Where did this man get these things?” and, “What is the wisdom that is given to this man, that such mighty works come about by his hands?
verses.ct: When the Sabbath came, he began teaching in the synagogue. Many who heard him were stunned. "Where did he learn all this?" they asked. "What kind of wisdom has he been given? How is he performing such incredible miracles?"

verses.kjv: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.
verses.web: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?” They were offended at him.
verses.ct: "Isn't this just the carpenter? Mary's son? The brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? Don't his sisters live right here among us?" They took offense at him.

verses.kjv: But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, but in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "A prophet is honored everywhere except in his own hometown, among his own relatives, and in his own house."

verses.kjv: And he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed them.
verses.web: He could do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people, and healed them.
verses.ct: He wasn't able to do any miracles there, except that he placed his hands on a few sick people and healed them.

verses.kjv: And he marvelled because of their unbelief. And he went round about the villages, teaching.
verses.web: He marveled because of their unbelief. He went around the villages teaching.
verses.ct: He was amazed at their lack of faith. Then he went around to the surrounding villages, teaching as he went.

verses.kjv: And he called unto him the twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits;
verses.web: He called to himself the twelve, and began to send them out two by two; and he gave them authority over the unclean spirits.
verses.ct: He called the 12 disciples together and began sending them out in pairs, giving them authority over evil spirits.

verses.kjv: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in their purse:
verses.web: He commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, except a staff only: no bread, no wallet, no money in their purse,
verses.ct: He told them to take nothing for the journey except a walking stick — no food, no bag, no money in their belts.

verses.kjv: But be shod with sandals; and not put on two coats.
verses.web: but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.
verses.ct: They could wear sandals but not pack an extra set of clothes.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, In what place soever ye enter into an house, there abide till ye depart from that place.
verses.web: He said to them, “Wherever you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from there.
verses.ct: He also told them, "When you enter a house, stay there until you leave that town.

verses.kjv: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.
verses.web: Whoever will not receive you nor hear you, as you depart from there, shake off the dust that is under your feet for a testimony against them. Assuredly, I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!”
verses.ct: If any place refuses to welcome you or listen to your message, shake the dust off your feet as you leave — as a witness against them. I tell you the truth, Sodom and Gomorrah will be better off on judgment day than that town."

verses.kjv: And they went out, and preached that men should repent.
verses.web: They went out and preached that people should repent.
verses.ct: So they went out and preached that people should repent.

verses.kjv: And they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed them.
verses.web: They cast out many demons, and anointed many with oil who were sick, and healed them.
verses.ct: They drove out many demons, anointed many sick people with oil, and healed them.

verses.kjv: And king Herod heard of him; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.
verses.web: King Herod heard this, for his name had become known, and he said, “John the Baptizer has risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him.”
verses.ct: King Herod heard about all of this, because Jesus' name had become widely known. Herod said, "John the Baptist has risen from the dead! That's why these miraculous powers are at work in him."

verses.kjv: Others said, That it is Elias. And others said, That it is a prophet, or as one of the prophets.
verses.web: But others said, “He is Elijah.” Others said, “He is a prophet, or like one of the prophets.”
verses.ct: Others were saying, "He's Elijah." Still others claimed, "He's a prophet, like one of the great prophets of old."

verses.kjv: But when Herod heard thereof, he said, It is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.
verses.web: But Herod, when he heard this, said, “This is John, whom I beheaded. He has risen from the dead.”
verses.ct: But when Herod heard the reports, he said, "It's John — the one I beheaded. He's come back from the dead."

verses.kjv: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias’ sake, his brother Philip’s wife: for he had married her.
verses.web: For Herod himself had sent out and arrested John, and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, for he had married her.
verses.ct: Here's what had happened: Herod himself had ordered John's arrest. He had him bound and thrown in prison because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, whom Herod had married.

verses.kjv: For John had said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother’s wife.
verses.web: For John said to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
verses.ct: John had been telling Herod, "It's against God's law for you to have your brother's wife."

verses.kjv: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:
verses.web: Herodias set herself against him, and desired to kill him, but she couldn’t,
verses.ct: Herodias held a bitter grudge against John and wanted him dead, but she couldn't make it happen.

verses.kjv: For Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just man and an holy, and observed him; and when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.
verses.web: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and kept him safe. When he heard him, he did many things, and he heard him gladly.
verses.ct: Herod actually feared John, knowing he was a righteous and holy man, so he kept him protected. Whenever Herod listened to John, he was deeply troubled — yet he kept wanting to hear more.

verses.kjv: And when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, high captains, and chief estates of Galilee;
verses.web: Then a convenient day came, that Herod on his birthday made a supper for his nobles, the high officers, and the chief men of Galilee.
verses.ct: Herodias finally got her chance. On Herod's birthday, he threw a banquet for his top officials, military commanders, and the leading men of Galilee.

verses.kjv: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in, and danced, and pleased Herod and them that sat with him, the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will give it thee.
verses.web: When the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and those sitting with him. The king said to the young lady, “Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you.”
verses.ct: During the celebration, Herodias's daughter came in and danced, delighting Herod and all his guests. The king told the girl, "Ask me for anything you want, and I'll give it to you."

verses.kjv: And he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give it thee, unto the half of my kingdom.
verses.web: He swore to her, “Whatever you shall ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom.”
verses.ct: He even swore an oath to her: "Whatever you ask, I'll give it to you — up to half my kingdom."

verses.kjv: And she went forth, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.
verses.web: She went out, and said to her mother, “What shall I ask?” She said, “The head of John the Baptizer.”
verses.ct: She stepped out and asked her mother, "What should I ask for?" Her mother answered, "The head of John the Baptist."

verses.kjv: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist.
verses.web: She came in immediately with haste to the king, and asked, “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptizer on a platter.”
verses.ct: The girl rushed back to the king and said, "I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a platter — right now."

verses.kjv: And the king was exceeding sorry; yet for his oath’s sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.
verses.web: The king was exceedingly sorry, but for the sake of his oaths, and of his dinner guests, he didn’t wish to refuse her.
verses.ct: The king was deeply distressed, but because of his oath and his dinner guests, he didn't want to refuse her.

verses.kjv: And immediately the king sent an executioner, and commanded his head to be brought: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,
verses.web: Immediately the king sent out a soldier of his guard, and commanded to bring John’s head, and he went and beheaded him in the prison,
verses.ct: So he immediately sent an executioner with orders to bring John's head. The soldier went to the prison and beheaded him.

verses.kjv: And brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the damsel gave it to her mother.
verses.web: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the young lady; and the young lady gave it to her mother.
verses.ct: He brought the head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.

verses.kjv: And when his disciples heard of it, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.
verses.web: When his disciples heard this, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.
verses.ct: When John's disciples heard what had happened, they came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.

verses.kjv: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had taught.
verses.web: The apostles gathered themselves together to Jesus, and they told him all things, whatever they had done, and whatever they had taught.
verses.ct: The apostles regrouped with Jesus and reported everything they had done and taught.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while: for there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.
verses.web: He said to them, “You come apart into a deserted place, and rest awhile.” For there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.
verses.ct: He said to them, "Come away with me to a quiet place and get some rest." People were constantly coming and going, and they didn't even have time to eat.

verses.kjv: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.
verses.web: They went away in the boat to a deserted place by themselves.
verses.ct: So they got in a boat and headed to a remote area by themselves.

verses.kjv: And the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.
verses.web: They saw them going, and many recognized him and ran there on foot from all the cities. They arrived before them and came together to him.
verses.ct: But people saw them leaving and recognized them. Crowds from every nearby town ran ahead on foot and arrived before them.

verses.kjv: And Jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.
verses.web: Jesus came out, saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd, and he began to teach them many things.
verses.ct: When Jesus stepped ashore and saw the massive crowd, his heart broke for them — they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began teaching them many things.

verses.kjv: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, This is a desert place, and now the time is far passed:
verses.web: When it was late in the day, his disciples came to him, and said, “This place is deserted, and it is late in the day.
verses.ct: Late in the afternoon, his disciples came to him and said, "This is a remote place, and it's getting very late.

verses.kjv: Send them away, that they may go into the country round about, and into the villages, and buy themselves bread: for they have nothing to eat.
verses.web: Send them away, that they may go into the surrounding country and villages, and buy themselves bread, for they have nothing to eat.”
verses.ct: Send the people away so they can go to the nearby farms and villages and buy themselves something to eat. They have no food."

verses.kjv: He answered and said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?
verses.web: But he answered them, “You give them something to eat.” They asked him, “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread, and give them something to eat?”
verses.ct: But Jesus replied, "You feed them." They stared at him. "Are you saying we should go spend 200 denarii on bread to feed all these people?"

verses.kjv: He saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? go and see. And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.
verses.web: He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go see.” When they knew, they said, “Five, and two fish.”
verses.ct: He asked them, "How many loaves do you have? Go check." They looked and came back: "5 loaves and 2 fish."

verses.kjv: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.
verses.web: He commanded them that everyone should sit down in groups on the green grass.
verses.ct: Jesus told them to have everyone sit down in groups on the green grass.

verses.kjv: And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.
verses.web: They sat down in ranks, by hundreds and by fifties.
verses.ct: So the people sat down in rows — groups of 100 and groups of 50.

verses.kjv: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave them to his disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.
verses.web: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves, and he gave to his disciples to set before them, and he divided the two fish among them all.
verses.ct: Jesus took the 5 loaves and the 2 fish, looked up to heaven, and gave thanks. Then he broke the loaves and handed them to his disciples to distribute. He also divided the 2 fish among everyone.

verses.kjv: And they did all eat, and were filled.
verses.web: They all ate, and were filled.
verses.ct: Everyone ate and had their fill.

verses.kjv: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.
verses.web: They took up twelve baskets full of broken pieces and also of the fish.
verses.ct: Afterward, they picked up 12 baskets full of leftover bread and fish.

verses.kjv: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.
verses.web: Those who ate the loaves were five thousand men.
verses.ct: The number of men who had eaten was about 5,000.

verses.kjv: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.
verses.web: Immediately he made his disciples get into the boat, and to go ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he himself sent the multitude away.
verses.ct: Right away, Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go ahead of him to Bethsaida on the other side, while he dismissed the crowd.

verses.kjv: And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.
verses.web: After he had taken leave of them, he went up the mountain to pray.
verses.ct: After saying goodbye to the people, he went up on a mountainside to pray.

verses.kjv: And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.
verses.web: When evening had come, the boat was in the middle of the sea, and he was alone on the land.
verses.ct: When evening came, the boat was out in the middle of the lake, and Jesus was alone on land.

verses.kjv: And he saw them toiling in rowing; for the wind was contrary unto them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.
verses.web: Seeing them distressed in rowing, for the wind was contrary to them, about the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea, and he would have passed by them,
verses.ct: He could see them straining at the oars because the wind was blowing against them. Sometime between 3 and 6 in the morning, he came toward them, walking on the water. He was about to pass by them,

verses.kjv: But when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:
verses.web: but they, when they saw him walking on the sea, supposed that it was a ghost, and cried out;
verses.ct: but when they saw him walking on the lake, they thought he was a ghost and screamed.

verses.kjv: For they all saw him, and were troubled. And immediately he talked with them, and saith unto them, Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.
verses.web: for they all saw him, and were troubled. But he immediately spoke with them, and said to them, “Cheer up! It is I! Don’t be afraid.”
verses.ct: They all saw him and were terrified. But he immediately called out to them, "Take courage! It's me. Don't be afraid."

verses.kjv: And he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.
verses.web: He got into the boat with them; and the wind ceased, and they were very amazed among themselves, and marveled;
verses.ct: He climbed into the boat with them, and the wind died down. They were completely stunned,

verses.kjv: For they considered not the miracle of the loaves: for their heart was hardened.
verses.web: for they hadn’t understood about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.
verses.ct: because they still hadn't grasped the meaning of the miracle with the loaves. Their hearts were hardened.

verses.kjv: And when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.
verses.web: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret, and moored to the shore.
verses.ct: They crossed the lake and landed at Gennesaret, pulling the boat up to shore.

verses.kjv: And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,
verses.web: When they had come out of the boat, immediately the people recognized him,
verses.ct: The moment they stepped out of the boat, people recognized Jesus.

verses.kjv: And ran through that whole region round about, and began to carry about in beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.
verses.web: and ran around that whole region, and began to bring those who were sick, on their mats, to where they heard he was.
verses.ct: They ran throughout the entire region, carrying the sick on mats to wherever they heard he was.

verses.kjv: And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.
verses.web: Wherever he entered, into villages, or into cities, or into the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces, and begged him that they might just touch the fringe of his garment; and as many as touched him were made well.
verses.ct: Everywhere he went — villages, cities, or countryside — people laid the sick in the marketplaces and begged him to let them touch even the edge of his clothing. And everyone who touched him was healed.
